result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore L. Karlstedt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes:
Court costs are due as follows: $25.00 is due on or before 9/15/2022 and then $25.00 is due by the 15th of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid or a civil judgment may be entered for collection purposes. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore L. Karlstedt

defendant.name: Karlstedt, Theodore L.
defendant.address: 610 N. 10th Place, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Theodore L. Karlstedt in court.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Theodore L. Karlstedt. Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 2. Count 1 DRI.
 Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia contrary to 961.573(1). Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: Plead to Count 2 without repeater enhancer; DRI Count 1; pay court costs only. 

Court adopts the joint recommendation: Orders court costs totaling $443.00.  Pay at $25.00 per month,  first payment due by 9/15/22 pay each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid or civil judgment entered for collection purposes. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.
